parameters.name: imageBuildVersionArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image that you want to get.

nested_items.name: requestId
nested_items.description: The request ID that uniquely identifies this request.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Specifies whether this image produces an AMI or a container image.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the image.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The semantic version of the image.

nested_items.name: platform
nested_items.description: The image operating system platform, such as Linux or Windows.

nested_items.name: enhancedImageMetadataEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether Image Builder collects additional information about the image, such as the operating system (OS) version and package list.

nested_items.name: osVersion
nested_items.description: The operating system version for instances that launch from this image. For example, Amazon Linux 2, Ubuntu 18, or Microsoft Windows Server 2019.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the image.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the status of the image.

nested_items.name: imageRecipe
nested_items.description: For images that distribute an AMI, this is the image recipe that Image Builder used to create the image. For container images, this is empty.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: Specifies which type of image is created by the recipe - an AMI or a container image.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: platform
nested_items.description: The platform of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the image recipe.

nested_items.name: components
nested_items.description: The components that are included in the image recipe. Recipes require a minimum of one build component, and can have a maximum of 20 build and test components in any combination.

nested_items.name: componentArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the component parameter to set.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Sets the value for the named component parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: parentImage
nested_items.description: The base image for customizations specified in the image recipe. You can specify the parent image using one of the following options:
AMI ID.
Image Builder image Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameter, prefixed by ssm:, followed by the parameter name or ARN.
Amazon Web Services Marketplace product ID.

nested_items.name: blockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mappings to apply when creating images from this recipe.

nested_items.name: deviceName
nested_items.description: The device to which these mappings apply.

nested_items.name: encrypted
nested_items.description: Use to configure device encryption.

nested_items.name: deleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

nested_items.name: iops
nested_items.description: Use to configure device IOPS.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

nested_items.name: snapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

nested_items.name: volumeSize
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume size.

nested_items.name: volumeType
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume type.

nested_items.name: throughput
nested_items.description: For GP3 volumes only --- The throughput in MiB/s that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: virtualName
nested_items.description: Use to manage instance ephemeral devices.

nested_items.name: noDevice
nested_items.description: Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date on which this image recipe was created.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: workingDirectory
nested_items.description: The working directory to be used during build and test workflows.

nested_items.name: additionalInstanceConfiguration
nested_items.description: Before you create a new AMI, Image Builder launches temporary Amazon EC2 instances to build and test your image configuration. Instance configuration adds a layer of control over those instances. You can define settings and add scripts to run when an instance is launched from your AMI.

nested_items.name: systemsManagerAgent
nested_items.description: Contains settings for the Systems Manager agent on your build instance.

nested_items.name: uninstallAfterBuild
nested_items.description: Controls whether the Systems Manager agent is removed from your final build image, prior to creating the new AMI. If this is set to true, then the agent is removed from the final image. If it's set to false, then the agent is left in, so that it is included in the new AMI. The default value is false.

nested_items.name: userDataOverride
nested_items.description: Use this property to provide commands or a command script to run when you launch your build instance.

nested_items.name: containerRecipe
nested_items.description: For container images, this is the container recipe that Image Builder used to create the image. For images that distribute an AMI, this is empty.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the container recipe.

nested_items.name: containerType
nested_items.description: Specifies the type of container, such as Docker.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the container recipe.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the container recipe.

nested_items.name: platform
nested_items.description: The system platform for the container, such as Windows or Linux.

nested_items.name: owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the container recipe.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The semantic version of the container recipe.

nested_items.name: components
nested_items.description: Build and test components that are included in the container recipe. Recipes require a minimum of one build component, and can have a maximum of 20 build and test components in any combination.

nested_items.name: componentArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the component.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: A group of parameter settings that Image Builder uses to configure the component for a specific recipe.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the component parameter to set.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Sets the value for the named component parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: instanceConfiguration
nested_items.description: A group of options that can be used to configure an instance for building and testing container images.

nested_items.name: image
nested_items.description: The base image for a container build and test instance. This can contain an AMI ID or it can specify an Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameter, prefixed by ssm:, followed by the parameter name or ARN.

nested_items.name: blockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: Defines the block devices to attach for building an instance from this Image Builder AMI.

nested_items.name: deviceName
nested_items.description: The device to which these mappings apply.

nested_items.name: encrypted
nested_items.description: Use to configure device encryption.

nested_items.name: deleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Use to configure delete on termination of the associated device.

nested_items.name: iops
nested_items.description: Use to configure device IOPS.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Use to configure the KMS key to use when encrypting the device.

nested_items.name: snapshotId
nested_items.description: The snapshot that defines the device contents.

nested_items.name: volumeSize
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume size.

nested_items.name: volumeType
nested_items.description: Use to override the device's volume type.

nested_items.name: throughput
nested_items.description: For GP3 volumes only --- The throughput in MiB/s that the volume supports.

nested_items.name: virtualName
nested_items.description: Use to manage instance ephemeral devices.

nested_items.name: noDevice
nested_items.description: Use to remove a mapping from the base image.

nested_items.name: dockerfileTemplateData
nested_items.description: Dockerfiles are text documents that are used to build Docker containers, and ensure that they contain all of the elements required by the application running inside. The template data consists of contextual variables where Image Builder places build information or scripts, based on your container image recipe.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: Identifies which KMS key is used to encrypt the container image for distribution to the target Region.

nested_items.name: encrypted
nested_items.description: A flag that indicates if the target container is encrypted.

nested_items.name: parentImage
nested_items.description: The base image for customizations specified in the container recipe. This can contain an Image Builder image resource ARN or a container image URI, for example amazonlinux:latest.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date when this container recipe was created.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: workingDirectory
nested_items.description: The working directory for use during build and test workflows.

nested_items.name: targetRepository
nested_items.description: The destination repository for the container image.

nested_items.name: service
nested_items.description: Specifies the service in which this image was registered.

nested_items.name: repositoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the container repository where the output container image is stored. This name is prefixed by the repository location. For example, <repository location url>/repository_name.

nested_items.name: sourcePipelineName
nested_items.description: The name of the image pipeline that created this image.

nested_items.name: sourcePipelineArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the image pipeline that created this image.

nested_items.name: infrastructureConfiguration
nested_items.description: The infrastructure that Image Builder used to create this image.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: instanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types of the infrastructure configuration.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: instanceProfileName
nested_items.description: The instance profile of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: securityGroupIds
nested_items.description: The security group IDs of the infrastructure configuration.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: subnetId
nested_items.description: The subnet ID of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: s3BucketName
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket in which to store the logs.

nested_items.name: s3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 path to the bucket where the logs are stored.

nested_items.name: keyPair
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 key pair of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: terminateInstanceOnFailure
nested_items.description: The terminate instance on failure configuration of the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: snsTopicArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the SNS topic to which we send image build event notifications.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date on which the infrastructure configuration was created.

nested_items.name: dateUpdated
nested_items.description: The date on which the infrastructure configuration was last updated.

nested_items.name: resourceTags
nested_items.description: The tags attached to the resource created by Image Builder.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: instanceMetadataOptions
nested_items.description: The instance metadata option settings for the infrastructure configuration.

nested_items.name: httpTokens
nested_items.description: Indicates whether a signed token header is required for instance metadata retrieval requests. The values affect the response as follows:

nested_items.name: httpPutResponseHopLimit
nested_items.description: Limit the number of hops that an instance metadata request can traverse to reach its destination. The default is one hop. However, if HTTP tokens are required, container image builds need a minimum of two hops.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: placement
nested_items.description: The instance placement settings that define where the instances that are launched from your image will run.

nested_items.name: availabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone where your build and test instances will launch.

nested_items.name: tenancy
nested_items.description: The tenancy of the instance. An instance with a tenancy of dedicated runs on single-tenant hardware. An instance with a tenancy of host runs on a Dedicated Host.

nested_items.name: hostId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Dedicated Host on which build and test instances run. This only applies if tenancy is host. If you specify the host ID, you must not specify the resource group ARN. If you specify both, Image Builder returns an error.

nested_items.name: hostResourceGroupArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the host resource group in which to launch build and test instances. This only applies if tenancy is host. If you specify the resource group ARN, you must not specify the host ID. If you specify both, Image Builder returns an error.

nested_items.name: distributionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The distribution configuration that Image Builder used to create this image.

nested_items.name: arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: distributions
nested_items.description: The distribution objects that apply Region-specific settings for the deployment of the image to targeted Regions.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The target Region.

nested_items.name: amiDistributionConfiguration
nested_items.description: The specific AMI settings; for example, launch permissions or AMI tags.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the output AMI.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the AMI distribution configuration. Minimum and maximum length are in characters.

nested_items.name: targetAccountIds
nested_items.description: The ID of an account to which you want to distribute an image.
(string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: kmsKeyId
nested_items.description: The KMS key identifier used to encrypt the distributed image.

nested_items.name: launchPermission
nested_items.description: Launch permissions can be used to configure which Amazon Web Services accounts can use the AMI to launch instances.

nested_items.name: userIds
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: userGroups
nested_items.description: The name of the group.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: organizationArns
nested_items.description: The ARN for an Amazon Web Services Organization that you want to share your AMI with. For more information, see What is Organizations?.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: organizationalUnitArns
nested_items.description: The ARN for an Organizations organizational unit (OU) that you want to share your AMI with. For more information about key concepts for Organizations, see Organizations terminology and concepts.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: containerDistributionConfiguration
nested_items.description: Container distribution settings for encryption, licensing, and sharing in a specific Region.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the container distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: containerTags
nested_items.description: Tags that are attached to the container distribution configuration.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: targetRepository
nested_items.description: The destination repository for the container distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: service
nested_items.description: Specifies the service in which this image was registered.

nested_items.name: repositoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the container repository where the output container image is stored. This name is prefixed by the repository location. For example, <repository location url>/repository_name.

nested_items.name: licenseConfigurationArns
nested_items.description: The License Manager Configuration to associate with the AMI in the specified Region.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: launchTemplateConfigurations
nested_items.description: A group of launchTemplateConfiguration settings that apply to image distribution for specified accounts.

nested_items.name: launchTemplateId
nested_items.description: Identifies the Amazon EC2 launch template to use.

nested_items.name: accountId
nested_items.description: The account ID that this configuration applies to.

nested_items.name: setDefaultVersion
nested_items.description: Set the specified Amazon EC2 launch template as the default launch template for the specified account.

nested_items.name: s3ExportConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configure export settings to deliver disk images created from your image build, using a file format that is compatible with your VMs in that Region.

nested_items.name: roleName
nested_items.description: The name of the role that grants VM Import/Export permission to export images to your S3 bucket.

nested_items.name: diskImageFormat
nested_items.description: Export the updated image to one of the following supported disk image formats:

nested_items.name: s3Bucket
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket in which to store the output disk images for your VM.

nested_items.name: s3Prefix
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 path for the bucket where the output disk images for your VM are stored.

nested_items.name: fastLaunchConfigurations
nested_items.description: The Windows faster-launching configurations to use for AMI distribution.

nested_items.name: enabled
nested_items.description: A Boolean that represents the current state of faster launching for the Windows AMI. Set to true to start using Windows faster launching, or false to stop using it.

nested_items.name: snapshotConfiguration
nested_items.description: Configuration settings for managing the number of snapshots that are created from pre-provisioned instances for the Windows AMI when faster launching is enabled.

nested_items.name: targetResourceCount
nested_items.description: The number of pre-provisioned snapshots to keep on hand for a fast-launch enabled Windows AMI.

nested_items.name: maxParallelLaunches
nested_items.description: The maximum number of parallel instances that are launched for creating resources.

nested_items.name: launchTemplate
nested_items.description: The launch template that the fast-launch enabled Windows AMI uses when it launches Windows instances to create pre-provisioned snapshots.

nested_items.name: launchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template to use for faster launching for a Windows AMI.

nested_items.name: launchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template to use for faster launching for a Windows AMI.

nested_items.name: launchTemplateVersion
nested_items.description: The version of the launch template to use for faster launching for a Windows AMI.

nested_items.name: accountId
nested_items.description: The owner account ID for the fast-launch enabled Windows AMI.

nested_items.name: ssmParameterConfigurations
nested_items.description: Contains settings to update Amazon Web Services Systems Manager (SSM) Parameter Store Parameters with output AMI IDs from the build by target Region.

nested_items.name: amiAccountId
nested_items.description: Specify the account that will own the Parameter in a given Region. During distribution, this account must be specified in distribution settings as a target account for the Region.

nested_items.name: parameterName
nested_items.description: This is the name of the Parameter in the target Region or account. The image distribution creates the Parameter if it doesn't already exist. Otherwise, it updates the parameter.

nested_items.name: dataType
nested_items.description: The data type specifies what type of value the Parameter contains. We recommend that you use data type aws:ec2:image.

nested_items.name: timeoutMinutes
nested_items.description: The maximum duration in minutes for this distribution configuration.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date on which this distribution configuration was created.

nested_items.name: dateUpdated
nested_items.description: The date on which this distribution configuration was last updated.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: imageTestsConfiguration
nested_items.description: The image tests that ran when that Image Builder created this image.

nested_items.name: imageTestsEnabled
nested_items.description: Determines if tests should run after building the image. Image Builder defaults to enable tests to run following the image build, before image distribution.

nested_items.name: timeoutMinutes
nested_items.description: The maximum time in minutes that tests are permitted to run.

nested_items.name: dateCreated
nested_items.description: The date on which Image Builder created this image.

nested_items.name: outputResources
nested_items.description: The output resources that Image Builder produces for this image.

nested_items.name: amis
nested_items.description: The Amazon EC2 AMIs created by this image.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region of the Amazon EC2 AMI.

nested_items.name: image
nested_items.description: The AMI ID of the Amazon EC2 AMI.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon EC2 AMI.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the Amazon EC2 AMI. Minimum and maximum length are in characters.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the image.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the status of the image.

nested_items.name: accountId
nested_items.description: The account ID of the owner of the AMI.

nested_items.name: containers
nested_items.description: Container images that the pipeline has generated and stored in the output repository.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: Containers and container images are Region-specific. This is the Region context for the container.

nested_items.name: imageUris
nested_items.description: A list of URIs for containers created in the context Region.
(string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: buildType
nested_items.description: Indicates the type of build that created this image. The build can be initiated in the following ways:

nested_items.name: imageSource
nested_items.description: The origin of the base image that Image Builder used to build this image.

nested_items.name: scanState
nested_items.description: Contains information about the current state of scans for this image.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current state of vulnerability scans for the image.

nested_items.name: reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the scan status for the image.

nested_items.name: imageScanningConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains settings for vulnerability scans.

nested_items.name: imageScanningEnabled
nested_items.description: A setting that indicates whether Image Builder keeps a snapshot of the vulnerability scans that Amazon Inspector runs against the build instance when you create a new image.

nested_items.name: ecrConfiguration
nested_items.description: Contains Amazon ECR settings for vulnerability scans.

nested_items.name: repositoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the container repository that Amazon Inspector scans to identify findings for your container images. The name includes the path for the repository location. If you don't provide this information, Image Builder creates a repository in your account named image-builder-image-scanning-repository for vulnerability scans of your output container images.

nested_items.name: containerTags
nested_items.description: Tags for Image Builder to apply to the output container image that Amazon Inspector scans. Tags can help you identify and manage your scanned images.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: deprecationTime
nested_items.description: The time when deprecation occurs for an image resource. This can be a past or future date.

nested_items.name: lifecycleExecutionId
nested_items.description: Identifies the last runtime instance of the lifecycle policy to take action on the image.

nested_items.name: executionRole
nested_items.description: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the IAM role you create that grants Image Builder access to perform workflow actions.

nested_items.name: workflows
nested_items.description: Contains the build and test workflows that are associated with the image.

nested_items.name: workflowArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the workflow resource.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: Contains parameter values for each of the parameters that the workflow document defined for the workflow resource.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the workflow parameter to set.

nested_items.name: value
nested_items.description: Sets the value for the named workflow parameter.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: parallelGroup
nested_items.description: Test workflows are defined within named runtime groups called parallel groups. The parallel group is the named group that contains this test workflow. Test workflows within a parallel group can run at the same time. Image Builder starts up to five test workflows in the group at the same time, and starts additional workflows as others complete, until all workflows in the group have completed. This field only applies for test workflows.

nested_items.name: onFailure
nested_items.description: The action to take if the workflow fails.
